text: Reading n lines from file (but not all) in Python
My question is how to read n lines from a file instead of just one when iterating over it.
I have a file which has well defined structure and I would like to do something like this:

code:
for line1, line2, line3 in file:
    do_something(line1)
    do_something_different(line2)
    do_something_else(line3)

text: but it doesn't work (ValueError: too many values to unpack)

childList.text: ValueError: too many values to unpack

text: For now I am doing this:

code:
for line in file:
    do_someting(line)
    newline = file.readline()
    do_something_else(newline)
    newline = file.readline()
    do_something_different(newline)
... etc.

text: which sucks because I am writing endless 'newline = file.readline()' which are cluttering the code.
Is there any smart way to do this ?
(I really want to avoid reading whole file at once because it is huge)
